result.execSummary:
The defendant Keona K McLeod was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Count 1 of case no. 15-CF-25. Concurrent with Counts 4, 6, 7, 8 of case no. 15-CF-25 and Count 1 of case no. 14-CM-241.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keona K McLeod

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Plea and Sentencing Hearing held 4/16/15

Defendant Keona K McLeod in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne. Defendant Keona K McLeod in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 2. Defense stipulates to convictions for repeater/second and subsequent allegations. Court questions Defendant, who agrees. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Count 1 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Defense advises of potential global resolution, requests hearing a couple weeks. Plea hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Keona K McLeod in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne. Defendant Keona K McLeod in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Keona K McLeod in court with along with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne who appears by phone.  Defendant Keona K McLeod in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions counsel on where matter is at.  Atty Heyne has reviewed all charges and penalties with defendant, anticipates waiver of prelim in felony files. Atty Heyne requests waiver of prelim hearing on March 30 when he'll be in Door County on another matter. Bond remains in effect.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 11:30 am.
from Atty Heyne requesting to appear by phone for 3/20/15 hearing. Court grants request.

Defendant Keona K Mcleod in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Atty Gerbers requests a status tracking 14-CM-241. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases

Defendant Keona K Mcleod in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on where she's at in retaining an attorney. Defendant indicates her employment situation has changed and she now qualifies for PD representation. Atty Peter Heyne has been appointed to represent her but he wasn't available today. Defendant requests another court date next week. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Keona K Mcleod
Current: 706 N. 5th Avenue, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States  (Effective: 01-15-2015)
Prior: 1201 S Duluth Avenue, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed within 10 days.

Defendant Keona K Mcleod in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant asks court to appoint an atty to represent her. Defendant to fill out form and file it with the court before next hearing. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Keona K Mcleod appeared by phone. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has pneumonia.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 10:15 am.
